Key Match Events: Jordan Ayew scored a late winner for Ghana in their 2-1 victory over Mali.
Kamory Doumbia scored the opener for Mali in added time of the first half.
Ernest Nuamah equalized for Ghana after a cross from Salis Samed in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Otto Addo later brought on Jordan Ayew, and the substitute became the game-changer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Stars started the match with good build-up play but later lost possession to the hosts, who took control of the game.
Mali broke the deadlock in the match in added time of the first half when Kamory Doumbia scored the opener.
Straight after passing the center circle, Ghana went in search of the equalizer, but there was not enough time left.
The Black Stars returned from the break much more rejuvenated and motivated.
